pkgmetadata.longdescription: python-flock============flock.Flock(fd, op)-------------------Flock object uses `fcntl.flock` to lock (resp. unlock)file descriptor (`fd`) with operation (`op`)when entering (resp. leaving) runtime context related to it.File objects providing a `fileno()` method are accepted as well.Operation is one of the following values: * `LOCK_SH` - acquire a shared lock * `LOCK_EX` - acquire an exclusive lockOperation can also be bitwise ORed with `LOCK_NB`to avoid blocking on lock acquisition.Example:-------- with open('/tmp/file.lock', 'w') as f: blocking_lock = flock.Flock(f, flock.LOCK_EX) noblocking_lock = flock.Flock(f, flock.LOCK_EX|flock.LOCK_NB) with blocking_lock: pass # do something here try: with noblocking_lock: pass # do something else here except BlockingIOError: pass
